title: Linking Formative Assessment and Teacher Beliefs: Democratic Teaching Practice Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of assessment concepts and elementary education curriculum
context.additional_context: Curriculum-linked program exploring the relationship between formative assessment practices and teacher beliefs for pre-service elementary teachers

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five core formative assessment strategies (feedback, self-assessment, collaborative learning, etc.) to actual lesson design
Learners can analyze how teachers' democratic beliefs (student empowerment, flexible lesson design, etc.) influence assessment method selection
Learners can develop at least three formative assessment tools reflecting individual learner characteristics and validate their feasibility

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
